summary: OpenLitterMap is an open-source project that aims to gamify real-time data collection of litter and plastic pollution. It allows users to earn Littercoin, which can be spent with eco-friendly merchants. The project has a significant user base and has collected a substantial amount of data, contributing to environmental awareness and action. The grant application outlines plans for further development, including releasing a new version, integrating feedback, and expanding the team.
review: The OpenLitterMap project presents a compelling case for funding due to its innovative approach to environmental data collection and its alignment with open-source principles. The project has demonstrated a strong user-centric design by engaging over 8,200 users across 100+ countries, who have contributed more than 500,000 images. This data is used to train an ethical AI, showcasing a clear, measurable outcome and contribution to the Web3 ecosystem. The gamification aspect, through Littercoin, adds a unique use case that differentiates it from other environmental projects. However, the application lacks detailed information on the sustainability of its revenue model and the specific use of grant funds, which are crucial for long-term viability. Additionally, the plan to hire 30+ team members seems ambitious without a clear financial strategy. The project could benefit from a more structured approach to resource allocation and a clearer demonstration of its governance model.

strengths.title: Innovative Gamification
strengths.description: The project uses gamification to engage users in environmental data collection, allowing them to earn Littercoin, which can be spent with eco-friendly merchants.

strengths.title: Strong User Engagement
strengths.description: With over 8,200 users in 100+ countries contributing more than 500,000 images, the project has demonstrated significant user engagement and community involvement.

strengths.title: Open Source Contribution
strengths.description: The project contributes to the open-source ecosystem by providing real-time data integration with OpenStreetMap and training an ethical AI.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Revenue Model Details
weaknesses.description: The application does not provide sufficient details on the sustainability of its revenue model, which is crucial for reducing dependency on continuous donations.

weaknesses.title: Ambitious Team Expansion
weaknesses.description: The plan to hire 30+ team members is ambitious and lacks a clear financial strategy to support such expansion.

weaknesses.title: Unclear Governance Structure
weaknesses.description: The application does not clearly outline the governance structure, which is important for ensuring community involvement and expert-led decision-making.

changes.title: Detail Revenue Model
changes.description: Provide a detailed explanation of the project's revenue model to demonstrate financial sustainability and reduce dependency on donations.

changes.title: Clarify Team Expansion Strategy
changes.description: Outline a clear financial strategy to support the planned expansion of the team, ensuring it is feasible and sustainable.

changes.title: Define Governance Structure
changes.description: Clearly define the governance structure to ensure strong community involvement and expert-led decision-making.
